results.title: Goblin market
results.creator_credit: Megan Harding, Belinda Hall, Rachel Perkins and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
“Morning and evening
maids heard the goblin cry,
come buy our orchid fruits
come buy, come buy”
Goblin market by Christina Rossetti
Adapted from the poem by Christina Rosette about an age-old myth as seen through contemporary Australian eyes.
Cast: Rachel Maza (Laura), Lisa Maza (Lizzie)

results.title: Gods Bones
results.creator_credit: Catherine Sinclair, Samantha Lang and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Angie is pregnant but who is the father? Is it the taxi-driver, the businessman, the actor or the medical student? The potential fathers-to-be are all in for an unexpected mail delivery - a letter with an unusual little parcel. A reminder of what could have been. Based on a short story by Yasunari Kawabata.
Cast: Olivia Pigeot, Brian Vriends, Bogdan Koga, Ritchie Singer, Kiri Paramore

results.title: True justice?
results.brief_description: Documentary containing sensitive material about the death, in 2004, of a young 17 year-old Aboriginal boy from Gamilaroi country (Walgett) known as TJ Hickey. Through interviews and news footage, the film attempts to establish the truth of what really happened to TJ whose “acccidental” death not only triggered a riot between the Redfern community and the police, but also conspiracy theories, rumours and media misinformation.
results.description: Documentary containing sensitive material about the death, in 2004, of a young 17 year-old Aboriginal boy from Gamilaroi country (Walgett) known as TJ Hickey. results.title: Fuse
results.creator_credit: Marcus Waters, Katherine Shortland, Maia Horniak and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A young Aboriginal girl wants to revenge the death of her older brother who has died while in jail for a petty crime. He was the only person she had in the world and now, desperately alone and angry, she finds the judge that sentenced her brother.
The film unfolds in the judge’s bachelor apartment where he is tied up and held captive as each of them confront their own judgements and their own pain.
An intense drama between two completely different people in one room over one night unfolds as they both behave in unexpected ways. Human emotions cross between the race, sex and class divide as each rediscover the meaning of loneliness, loss and judgement.
Cast: Shai Pittman, Chris Haywood

results.title: Blood brothers
results.creator_credit: Jessica Cribb, Rebecca Parker and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Paul and Ben are blood brothers. They’ve got heaps of brothers and sisters, but they’re the only ones with the same mum and dad. They live in Willmot, an isolated community on the outskirts of Western Sydney. It’s a no-go zone, a suburban wasteland with huge powerlines overhead. Paul and Ben struggle to survive poverty, “westie” stigma, violence and abuse. Each has their own way of keeping feelings of powerlessness and fear at bay but, ultimately, they have each other. Their story is about family, love, loyalty and what it truly means to be a blood brother.

results.title: Too little justice
results.creator_credit: Marcus Waters, Justin Davies, Dean Francis and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
“Everyday” racism escalates into violence as an indigenous school boy is forced to fight for dignity. When he is framed for drugs by a racist student, he realizes he is trapped in a cycle of systemic cultural bias.
Cast: George Barker, Shannon Cole
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marcus Waters, Justin Davies, Dean Francis and AFTRS

results.title: Weeping willow
results.creator_credit: Louise Woodruff Sanz, Nicholas Price, Adrian Wills and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
She once described his dancing as being like the wind through the willow trees. She was his mentor and his best friend. She was his mum. Weeping Willow is the story of a dancer coming to terms with the death of his closest friend and biggest fan. It documents their journey to the present and into the future.
Features Gary Lang, Marilyn Miller, Lydia Miller, Joel Donahue
Contains some b&w images
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louise Woodruff Sanz, Nicholas Price, Adrian Wills and AFTRS
results.description:

results.title: Left lane ends
results.creator_credit: Alice Addison, Steve Pasvolsky, Sofya Gollan and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Not paid sex, not Sleep-Eez, not working the late-night shift can help Danny sleep. Not until his ritual gets invaded by a girl.
Cast: Sam Lewis, Kate Beahan, Kris McQuade, Russell Cheek

results.title: Grace
results.creator_credit: Alice Addison, Isabel Perez, Damien Power and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A lonely girl left looking after the family motel finds her life is about to change when a sophisticated and elegant woman books in for the night.
Cast: Mariel McClovey, Angela Punch McGregor, Tim Richards

results.title: Dressing dad
results.creator_credit: Lynne Vincent McCarthy, Isabel Perez, Sofya Gollan and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
If your dad wore a dress, would it make him less of a father, less of a man? A daughter’s journey to understand her father’s long-kept secret as a cross-dresser.
Cast: Alastair Barns (the dad), Lynne Vincent McCarthy as the daughter voice-over, and Leslie, Bianca, Kimberley, Steffie and Kim.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynne Vincent McCarthy, Isabel Perez, Sofya Gollan and AFTRS
results.description:
